Skinny Guacamole:

2 medium green sweet peppers
2 medium fresh poblano chile peppers
1 bulb garlic
1/2 teaspoon olive oil
2 roma tomatoes, seeded and chopped
1 serrano pepper, minced
2 medium ripe avocados, halved, seeded, peeled, and diced
1 teaspoon lime zest
2 tablespoons lime juice
1/2 teaspoon salt

Baked Tortilla Chips:

Corn tortillas
Olive oil spray
Salt

For the guacamole:

Preheat oven to 425° F. Line a 15 x 10 x 1-inch baking pan with foil; set aside. Quarter, stem, and seed the peppers. Place pepper quarters, cut sides down, in the prepared pan. Cut off the top half inch of the garlic bulb to expose ends of individual cloves. Leaving garlic bulb whole, remove any loose, papery outer layers. Place bulb, cut end up, on a double thickness of foil. Drizzle with the oil. Bring foil up around bulb and fold edges together to loosely enclose. Place foil packet on the pan with the peppers.
Roast peppers and garlic for 20 to 30 minutes or until pepper skins are charred and garlic cloves feel soft. Allow to cool about 15 minutes. When garlic head is cool enough to handle, squeeze garlic paste out of the individual cloves.
In a food processor combine roasted pepper quarters and the garlic paste. Cover and pulse until combined, but still slightly chunky.
In a large bowl, combine tomatoes and serrano pepper. Add roasted pepper and garlic combination and stir to combine. Add diced avocado, lime zest, lime juice, and salt. Gently toss to combine.
Serve immediately or cover the surface with plastic wrap and chill for up to 1 hour.
For the chips:

Cut corn tortillas into wedges and place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Spray lightly with olive oil spray and season with salt, to taste.
Bake in a 350° F oven for 8-10 minutes or until lightly golden brown.

Right.. now this game. Let me start off by saying it seems good. It's quite unique in the sense you can play in both first-person and third-person. Due to preference. Now that's a good feature. As well as there being some quite interesting weapons too. All seeming quite unique. But the cons in this case, definately out-weigh the pros.

Okay, so the sound in this game, is awful. I don't mean the gunfire (though sometimes even if there are different weapons some sound the same) but the territory which you tread on. It feels so un-finished and like it's in some kind of testing stage. I thought this game would be good it seemed decent but no. This game is just completely ♥♥♥♥. You just go onto servers and there are either veterans, or noobs. And there are only ever about 2 servers active on exactly the same maps. And the sound like I said, can also be extremely misleading. For example, you don't even make some sort of splashing sound when going through water, and if you previously walked on some kind of metallic surface and then continued to walk onto a path which is dirt or grass, you hear the same sound until the game finally decides to correct itself.

The game modes and maps however, this game lacks them A LOT. It's been out for a good I believe, 2-3 years (I may be wrong) and still has an extremely limited variety. The starter weapons for each class are quite weighed out, but it just feels really pay-2-win. I'm not saying that it is, but it seems that the weapons overall are just un-balanced when you take a look at the stats. As well as the armour. If I were you, I'd keep away from this buggy mess of a game. Oh also there are extremely misleading holes in some walls, that you can not shoot through. The terrain in the game is also just awful. The game presents itself to be somewhat high-quality though it is certainly the opposite.

I'd advise everyone to keep as far away from this terrible game as possible. It's not worth your time, nor is it worth the 3-4 hour download +1 additional hour to install updates within the launcher itself.

Physics are not good, ragdoll simulations are some of the worst.

5/10 - Try to avoid, not worthwhile.

My comment on the skill tree system, I chose medic, and until I unlock skills you start off as a standard normal fps shooter. Not a problem. What bewildered me was the lack of explanation on certain skills that i could choose to spend my skill points on, and what really threw me off is, as a medic, you would believe you heal teammates. reviewText:
I don't really know where to start too well because this is the first review I've written up, but I'm going to try to start by saying that there used to be a game called Battlefield Play4Free. Now, this game was a serious gem. It really required skill, tactics, and understanding of the maps and weapons you were dealing with. It wasn't like Call of Duty, where your guns kick like babies and as long as you keep your reflex sight on something you hit it, it had insane recoil, lots of spread, large variations in damage. All the guns were very diverse; none were the same, and excluding a few, they were all very balanced. The map design for the most part was amazing and well thought out. But no one gave this game credit for what it was, which in my opinion was probably one of the best multiplayer exclusive games ever created, just because of small issues like bad starting weapons, a pay to win system, and a few hackers. Eventually, because EA handed the game to a smaller company that co-owned it (EAsy), the community eventually started dying out and the game was shut down even after various offers to purchase it from players and other companies.

This game really does remind me of Battlefield Play4Free. I think it's incredibly fun, and the weapon balance, despite starting with mediocre weapons, is excellent. There are no two guns alike with one better in some way (like BF3, where the M16A3 trumps all) and all of them feel slightly different and behave differently. The map design feels relatively nice and there aren't any of those stupid maps where the center is a chokepoint/slaughterfest for either team. So far I haven't found but a few glitches and none of them have to do with abusing maps; mostly just audio and graphics glitches (i.e. fire a rifle and unscope and it doesn't go through the bolting animation). Please, I just ask of you, that if you happen to come across this review, seriously try the game, even if you don't spend much time on it. This community is slowly dying as well, and I don't want another amazing game to slip between our fingers.

Overall Pros:
Very good weapon balance
Fun, balanced maps
Great gameplay
Weapons CAN be bought permanently WITHOUT spending any real money (Daily rewards, WP, crates)
Nice map and weapon diversity
Great customization system

Overall Cons:
Some hackers
Enough WP to buy guns is harder to get than it should be
Clunky gameplay (but still fun)
Occasional glitches
Somewhat confusing user interface

Overall, I think it's a great game. Please don't overlook it.

reviewText:
Nice looking graphics (decent textures and animations). Large arsenal of equipment at your disposal. Ability to play in first or third person. Fast-paced action.

However, the game still lacks in several aspects and with the abandonment by the developers, I highly doubt we'll ever see this game meet its potential.

Obviously, the most frustrating yet reasonable element of the game is the inclusion of an in-game currency only attainable through real money. The game often becomes a pay-to-win game, unless you happen to have an equally powerful weapon. But of course, this trend has been recurring in majority of the free-to-play games on the market. After all, developers need to find a way to earn revenue.

If you're looking for a quick fix of shooters then War Inc should do the job, otherwise, look somewhere else (Planetside 2 maybe?)

reviewText:
For an FPS that sadly hasn't updated since 2012 this seems nifty and fun. I'd say cs:go even took features from this game to add to theirs.

Although it hasn't been updated since 2012, I stilled managed to get a game instantly in November 2014 and had many postivies

Positives:
♦ Matches a short
♦ Matches are fun
♦ Good Voice over when playing Capture the Zone to tell you when an enemy has caputred/started capturing a zone
♦ Good idea to get crates from killing people which can be unlocked for a small price to get premium weapons
♦ Definitely didn't seem pay to win
♦ Epic level system and skill system
♦ Balanced (I hadn't played since 2012 and I was getting first place... go figure)
♦ Has ingame currency and premium currency
♦ Free to Play
♦ Fun
♦ Lots of Achievements
♦ Definitely no hackers from what I saw
♦ Epic number of weapons and loadouts

The only negatives I saw are:

Negatives:
♦ No updates since 2012
♦ Premium Weapons Expire
♦ Not able to trade Premium Weapons and items on Steam like in cs:go


Overall, in my opinion, the game is a really fun FPS concidering it was made in 2011 with no updates in 2012. Things are payable to get but don't need to be and don't give you an advantage over others who didn't pay for items. Really well built, love the level system and the ingame voice overs/crate idea. One of the best FPS's for todays times that I'd highly recommend.

Overall, I'd rate this 3/5!

PS: It'd be a 5/5 if it was still updated. Though it's still active and I didn't see any hackers. I got a game instantly as of November 2014 and I got First Place on my team and I hadn't played since 2012. Also, I have killed 96 players 10 levels higher than me... so before you say this review is biased or I haven't played enough... go figure.

reviewText:
So I figured I'd try the game that WarZ/ISS had a ton of its content based off of and ported from. Was surprisingly slightly better than I expected. People said there would be hackers and pay-to-win players, but really, it's just low-level players with the same unlocked gear as you.

That said, the last time this game was updated was about 18 months ago, but it will still process your credit card. Lag and desync issues ruin combat, because enemies tank shots and instakill you. Game doesn't look too bad but sound effects are monotonous and bugged.

Games aren't too long (8-15 minutes), but you'll either end up carrying your team because they're all stupid or losing horribly. Spawn camping happens frequently.

Honestly I'd probably give this game a 4/10. Good practice for I:SS PVP if you'd like to use it as such. Would not recommed for having fun with, though.
